Description: A: 180 disc-shaped beads made of faience, few of them still have blue glaze preserved, many small fragments of further beads preserved. B: One somewhat larger disc-shaped bead and one barrel-shaped bead made of white faience. C: About 13 fragments of further faience objects, all broken so that the original shape is not identifiable. Like core pieces but glazed, remains of production?
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), South-west of main gate
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
